definition: to mediate/to broker a compromise
circle/round/circular/spherical/(of the moon) full/unit of Chinese currency (yuan)/tactful/to make consistent and whole (the narrative of a dream or a lie)
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
to help to resolve a dispute/to smooth things over
to walk around the stage (to indicate scene changes)

sentences.english: The talking head, the host, is required to make the transition then, so the obvious is obscured.
sentences.chinese: 發言人，主持人被要求打圓場，將其掩蓋過去。

sentences.english: A bit of spot putty to smooth things over and then I sanded it smooth.
sentences.chinese: 有點現貨的膩子，以打圓場，然後我用砂紙它順利。

sentences.english: Nine younger sister know four xi again dozen circle field, ran out of gas.
sentences.chinese: 九妹知道四喜又在打圓場，氣得跑了出去。

definition: sullen/to scowl miserably
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
red in the face/extremely angry
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
to turn pale with fright (idiom)
dejected/despondent/depressed
spitting anger (idiom); in a rage
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
lit. to bring a bramble and ask for punishment (idiom)/fig. to offer sb a humble apology
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
to glare at
